data.title: BRASSIER & MALIK. Reason Is Inconsolable and Non-Conciliatory. Interview
data.meta_description:
BRASSIER & MALIK. Reason is Inconsolable and Non-conciliatory. Interview - Free download as Word Doc (.doc), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document summarizes an interview between Suhail Malik and Ray Brassier regarding Brassier's philosophical work. 

Malik asks why Brassier has shifted focus from the grand, cosmological ideas in his earlier work like Nihil Unbound to more modest topics centered around Wilfrid Sellars' philosophy in his recent work. Brassier responds that his focus on Sellars is a continuation, not a retreat, from his agenda defending the link between rationality and nihilism. He explains that Sellars' notion of "discursive commitment" and inferentialism provides a framework for understanding rationality as autonomous yet naturally and socially embodied.
